definition: to take over (from those working the previous shift)/to take over (in a leadership role etc)/to succeed sb
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: At the same time, the North is going through a murky, ill-understood succession crisis.
sentences.chinese: 同時，北方正在經歷一個模糊而難以讀懂的接班危機。

sentences.english: IX. Strictly stick to the handing-over system.
sentences.chinese: 第九條嚴格執行交接班制度。

sentences.english: We veteran cadres have the responsibility of making earnest efforts to select successors.
sentences.chinese: 我們老幹部的責任就是要認真選好接班人。

sentences.english: Ensuring the shift is reviewed and hand-over and briefings are carried out.
sentences.chinese: 確保每個班次的回顧交接班及例會的召開。

sentences.english: The successor of family business in our country is usually the owner's son or daughter.
sentences.chinese: 目前我國家族企業接班人選擇主要是子承父業的方式。

sentences.english: Mr. Chan's experience makes him a natural candidate to succeed Mr. Yam.
sentences.chinese: 陳德霖的經驗使他成爲任志剛順理成章的接班候選人。

sentences.english: But one of his successors in the White House had about as checkered a youth as can be imagined.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在白宮他的一位接班人青年時代卻歷盡艱辛。

sentences.english: These leaders are responsible for overseeing all employee training and succession-planning programs.
sentences.chinese: 這些高管負責監督員工培訓及接班人計劃的落實。

sentences.english: Changing of guard at Anit Kabir Mausoleum at Ataturk Monument.
sentences.chinese: 凱末爾紀念館，阿塔圖爾克雕像前的警衛交接班儀式。

sentences.english: He is considered by many people as "song god" Jacky cheung's successor .
sentences.chinese: 他被很多人認爲是“歌神”張學友的接班人。

sentences.english: Builders and successors featuring an all-round development in morality, intelligence, physique and art.
sentences.chinese: 培養德智體美全面發展的社會主義建設者和接班人。

sentences.english: The Drillers must exchange hand-over notes between each tour.
sentences.chinese: 每次交接班時，司鑽一定要交換交接班記錄。

sentences.english: The Drillers must exchange hand-over notes between each tour.
sentences.chinese: 每次交接班時，司鑽一定要交換交接班記錄。

sentences.english: I work on the day shift.
sentences.chinese: 他們等待着日班的工人來接班。

sentences.english: Why do I need succession planning?
sentences.chinese: 我爲什麼要有接班計劃？

sentences.english: Now the safety culture, a good future successor.
sentences.chinese: 現在安全學文化，將來當好接班人。

definition: to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to withdraw to the second line of duty/to resign from a leading post (and assume an advisory post)
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
player whose turn comes next (in a game)/next one/my humble home
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
